אֵת.text: The Hebrew word אֵת is the Hebrew direct object pronoun.

tokensOfLine.text: Every language must clarify who is doing the action and who the action is being done to.
In English, we use word order to convey this. So, “the man at the apple” is clear because the doer is always before the verb.
Semetic languges however allow the doer to be mentioned after the verb, such as אוכל את תפוח אדם (
